reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in mid-March 2005 while we were picking up our daughter from WSU. My husband loved the indoor hot tub. My son was disappointed that the pool was outside and therefore not open. The breakfast bar had a great selection including biscuits and gravy, hard boiled eggs, fresh pastries and cereal. The first day we went to breakfast a bit late so the sausage gravy had been strained by previous guests so there wasn't much sausage in it. Being a bit earlier the next day proved that the gravy could be better. A previous guest mentioned cookies at night, but I didn't hear anything about that while we were there. The room was clean and spacious. I would stay here again... though I would also consider the Holiday Inn Express since it has an in-door pool.
reviews.title: Worked well for us

reviews.text: Stayed for a few nights in April, 2008. Room was large, and included a small fridge, microwave and larger table with chairs. This isn't a new property, but appeared to be well maintained.
reviews.title: Quality Option in Pullman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty complete... hard boiled eggs, fresh make-your-own waffles, bagels, toast, pastries, fruit cocktail, biscuits with gravy, cereal, yogurt, coffee and juices and was served from 6am-10am.
reviews.title: Mostly fine but with one problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the evening from 8:30-9:30pm they offer fresh cookies and milk in the lobby. Nice touch.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice in Pullman

reviews.text: There was a traveling HS group while we were there - a little noisy at times, though just turned on the fan in the room and that drowned out any noise.
reviews.title: Good Room. Good Breakfast
Quality time at the Quality Inn
